title.quote:
Published as a workshop paper at AI4Mat 2024
A R EINFORCEMENT L EARNING P IPELINE FOR B AND G AP - DIRECTED C RYSTAL G ENERATION

extractions.description: The paper presents a reinforcement learning pipeline combined with DFT simulations to optimize crystal compositions for a target band gap, addressing challenges in AI-driven material discovery.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments and analysis to demonstrate the performance of the proposed pipeline and highlights challenges for future improvement.
type.quote: Overall, through simple experiments, we demonstrate the performance of an online RL approach for band gap-conditioned crystal generation and highlight the challenges for future work.

name.justification: The paper discusses the application of reinforcement learning specifically for optimizing crystal compositions to achieve certain material properties.
name.quote: This study aims to extend the work by incorporating DFT simulations in an online RL training pipeline such that the number of DFT calls is reduced.

name.justification: The paper focuses on optimizing material properties, specifically the band gap of crystals.
name.quote: In automated material design, considering the difficulty of using offline RL approaches and the impracticality of fully DFT-based online approaches, we emphasize the need for a middle ground that uses both machine learning property predictors and DFT.

name.justification: The paper extensively uses Density Functional Theory (DFT) simulations, which are quantum mechanical simulations, to evaluate materials.
name.quote: Calls to DFT are made at a fixed frequency, allowing fine-tuning of the reward model after every successful DFT simulation.

name.justification: The paper implements DQN as part of their reinforcement learning pipeline for optimizing crystal compositions.
name.quote: We implement Deep Q Networks (DQN) with a pretrained neural network reward function that acts as a proxy for the band gap output of DFT.

is_contributed.justification: DQN is used as part of the methodology, not introduced as a new contribution in the paper.
is_contributed.quote: We implement Deep Q Networks (DQN) with a pretrained neural network reward function that acts as a proxy for the band gap output of DFT.

is_executed.justification: The model is specifically used in the experiment as part of the RL pipeline.
is_executed.quote: Our first online RL experiment deals with training DQN to optimize the composition of a single crystal skeleton for the band gap.

is_compared.justification: The paper does not explicitly mention comparing DQN with other models numerically in the scope of the paper.
is_compared.quote: This study aims to extend the work by incorporating DFT simulations in an online RL training pipeline such that the number of DFT calls is reduced.
